çº¦ä¹¦äºšÂ·å¸ƒæ´›èµ«

#â€‹663 â€” November 16, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Prettier 3.1 Released â€” The popular opinionated code formatter has a new release including support for the new control flow syntax in Angular 17 plus a new, experimental formatting option for ternary expressions (as in x ? y : z) explained in more depth in "A curious case of the ternaries."

Alex Rattray

ğŸ¤” With an aim to making code formatting even faster, Prettier's co-creator has put up a $10k bounty for any Rust project that passes >95% of Prettier's tests.

Exploring Explicit Resource Management in JS â€” A practical look at the idea of explicit resource management, an idea both currently at stage 3 in TC39 (and partly supported in TypeScript 5.2) that makes it easier to â€˜clean upâ€™ resources once they are no longer used or needed.

Ilia Pozdnyakov

Build Interactive, Live Video Applications with Amazon IVS â€” Amazon Interactive Video Service (Amazon IVS) allows developers to create dynamic video experiences, such as collaborative real-time livestreams. Check out the new ivs.rocks to find code samples, demos, and other resources. Click here to get started.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) sponsor

On HTML Web Components â€” â€œWith web components, you might even say Reactâ€™s component model is being ported to the browser. But itâ€™s being done in a way that works to enhance how the web already works, not replace itâ€.

Jim Nielsen

A Review of Lightweight JavaScript Frameworks â€” This overview is targeted at Django (i.e. Python) developers but if you, too, want to avoid larger frameworks like React or Angular, you might appreciate this look at numerous alternatives from Stimulus and htmx to more oblique options like Laravel Livewire.

Michael Yin

  • ğŸ¥³ AWS is celebrating a huge release with v6 of the AWS Amplify JavaScript library which includes full support for Next.js App Router and Server Actions.

  • ğŸŒ Node.js TSC member Yagiz Nizipli is suggesting using Biome for code formatting in Node, since ESLint has deprecated its core formatting rules.

  • ğŸ‘¾ The winners of React Jam, a recent React-based game development contest, have been revealed. An entry I enjoyed was useChess, a set of chess-based puzzles.

  • â–¶ï¸ If you've wondered what the big deal is about Astro, James Q Quick went on the Software Engineering Daily podcast and explained Astro pretty well.

  • ğŸµ Someone's recorded â–¶ï¸ a rap music video about TypeScript..

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v21.2.0 (Current)

  • visx 3.5 â€“ D3-based visualization primitives for React.

  • fx 31.0 â€“ Powerful terminal JSON viewer.

  • Astro 3.5, Ember 5.4, and Prisma 5.6.

ğŸ“„ Articles & Tutorials

67 Browser-Based Debugging Tricks â€” A list of useful, â€˜not-obviousâ€™ hacks to get the most out of the browserâ€™s DevTools. Assumes a reasonable existing understanding of said tools.

Alan Norbauer

Exploring V8's Strings: Implementation and Optimizations â€” Note: This is very technical and most JavaScript developers do not need to go this deep. That aside, this is a fantastic look under the covers of how the V8 engine handles strings, including the optimizations used that allow it to go toe to toe with languages like C++.

Ilia Pozdnyakov

JavaScript Scratchpad for VS Code â€” Quokka.js is the #1 tool for exploring/testing JavaScript with edit-continue experience to see realtime execution and runtime values.

Wallaby Team sponsor

â–¶  An Overview of Angular 17's New Built-In Control Flow â€” Angular 17 was released last week and a significant enhancement was support for a new syntax in templates that looks and feels more JavaScript-y.

Dmytro Mezhenskyi

Moving Back to React (from Preact) â€” Preact felt like a logical, lightweight choice to this team at one time, but theyâ€™ve switched to React for better compatibility with Next.js, among other things. Their page weight is up slightly, but they feel the tradeoff is worth it.

Ante BariÄ‡ (Dailyâ€¤Dev)

My Journey to 3x Faster Builds: Trimming Barrel File Imports â€” â€œI maintain a small frontend application (4K LOC) which uses Vite as the compiler. The production build, using npm run build, was taking 26 secs on Github Actions. It seemed awfully slow for such a small application. I decided to investigate why.â€

Ramana Venkata

Can Bun Eat Nodeâ€™s 'Lunch'? â€” An experiment in migrating a codebase (a restaurant voting app called Lunch) from Node over to Bun and seeing how it fares.

Jeffrey Carl Faden

Feel the Power of More Than 420,000 Teammates and Work #LikeABosch

Bosch sponsor

How to Use NPM Packages Outside of Node â€” Learn how to run NPM packages in â€˜other placesâ€™ like serverless platforms, the browser, and beyond.

George MacKerron (Neon)

What I Learned Building an Audio Plugins System for the Web
Ben Wiley

Rust for JavaScript Developers: An Overview of Testing
Joshua Mo

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

gsplat.js: A Gaussian Splatting Library â€” Gaussian splatting is an increasingly popular graphics rendering techniques where rather than render millions of tiny, textured triangles in a scene, you get a more wild paintball-like splatter fest, where each paintball creates a smooth, colorful blob instead of a rigid shape. This demo is both simple and striking.

Dylan Ebert

Reveal.js 5.0: The HTML Presentation Framework â€” A way to build presentations using standard Web technologies. The projectâ€™s homepage is, itself, such a presentation. v5.0 adds support for â€˜scroll modeâ€™ which essentially turns presentations into more typically scrolling Web experiences â€“ demo.

Hakim El Hattab

ğŸ–ï¸ Marker.io: Collect Bug Reports With Annotations & Session Replay â€” Collect feedback on live websites. Get dev-friendly bug reports with screenshots, URLs, console logs & session replay.

Marker.io sponsor

Datasheet Grid: An Airtable-like React Component â€” If youâ€™ve got an array of objects and you want a way for users to manipulate them, this is for you. Itâ€™s not going to replace a spreadsheet or an extensive data grid framework, but itâ€™s a mature solution featuring smooth animations, virtualized rows/columns, keyboard navigation, and more.

Nicolas Keller

Perfect Freehand: A Library for Creating Better 'Freehand' Lines â€” You can try it out here. Makes your e-signature not look like chicken scratch! Might be useful for drawing apps.

Steve Ruiz

Wild Wild Path v5: Object Property Paths with Wildcards and Regexps â€” A 'wild' way to access properties in objects (which can be deeply nested) by way of string based queries that support wildcards and regexes. The examples help communicate the idea.

ehmicky

@storybook-test: More Streamlined and Powerful Storybook Testing â€” @storybook/test consolidates the API of @storybook/jest and @storybook/testing-library into a new, single package, powered by Vitest.

Kasper Peulen

  • Marked 10.0 â€“ Markdown parser and compiler. There's also marked-terminal 6.1 which lets you render Marked-processed Markdown on the terminal.

  • HumanizeDuration.js 3.31.0 â€“ Turn milliseconds into textual durations in numerous natural languages.

  • actions/github-script 7.0 â€“ Script the GitHub API in GitHub Actions.

  • Plasmo v0.84.0 â€“ "Like Next.js for browser extensions."

  • PDFKit 0.14.0 â€“ PDF generation for Node and browser.

  • React Joyride 2.7 â€“ Create guided tours in your apps.

Job Listing

Full Stack TypeScript Software Engineer - [Remote Europe] â€” Marker.io is a visual bug-reporting tool for the web. Join our dev team and work remotely (Stack: Node.js, Vue.js & MongoDB).

NOTABLE QUOTABLE

â€œWhen you choose a language, youâ€™re choosing more than a set of technical trade-offs â€“ youâ€™re choosing a community.â€

___
Joshua Bloch

#â€‹662 â€” November 9, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Reintroducing Angular with Angular v17 â€” Angular first appeared in the shape of AngularJS in 2010 and helped launch a wave of large-scale JavaScript frameworks. Angular remains popular in many use cases but is often overlooked in favor of newer options. v17 takes a leap forward in both features and vision, with the team rebranding Angular and repositioning it as a modern solution:

  • Angular.dev is an all-new docs site and home for the project (the new guides look fantastic). It's in beta till Angular v18 is released â€“ you can learn more about it here.
  • Hydration is now production ready.
  • Vite and esbuild are the default for new projects.
  • Improved support for creating server side apps.
  • New, improved built-in control flow to make code less verbose.
  • Google pulled out all the stops for â–¶ï¸ the 'Special Angular Event' â€“ an hour of talks, interviews and discussions to bring you up to speed.

Minko Gechev and the Angular Team

Bare Metal JavaScript: The JavaScript Virtual Machine with MiÅ¡ko Hevery â€” Learn how high-level JavaScript turns into low-level CPU instructions. Build up your mental model of JavaScript's performance characteristics through understanding the JavaScript Virtual machine under the hood!

Frontend Masters sponsor

Mastering DOM Manipulation with Plain JavaScript â€” A mega collection of hundreds of examples of doing things like selecting text, manipulating elements, resizing things, scrolling, and such â€“ all by using the DOM and browser APIs with no external libraries. You Might Not Need jQuery is another classic resource in a similar vein.

Phuoc Nguyen

â–¶  Why Signals Are Better Than React Hooks â€” When Preactâ€™s Marvin Hagemeister pops up in the comments saying â€œthis is by far the best video about signals and why they are so exciting. I love the way you demonstrate it by coding along and moving an app over to signals,â€ it should bump a video up to the top of the Watch Later playlist.

Web Dev Simplified

  • ğŸ‘€ Nicholas C. Zakas shares a look at what's coming in ESLint v9.0. The first alpha is due in a month or two.

  • âš›ï¸ React has landed a commit adding sourcemaps for prod build artifacts.

  • ğŸ†š VS Code will soon support moving editors into floating windows.

RELEASES:

  • TypeScript 5.3 RC â€“ Final due soon, but you get import attributes, resolution-mode in import types, interactive inlay hints for types, and improvements to narrowing in a few extra cases.

  • It's a strong week for testing tool releases, so they're all in one place: TestCafe v3.4.0, Cypress 13.5, Nightwatch.js 3.3, and React Testing Library 14.1.

  • Deno 1.38 â€“ Many smaller improvements, including far faster JSX transformation.

  • Bun v1.0.10 â€“ Faster node:http and bug fixes.

  • tsx 4.0 â€“ Node.js enhanced to run TypeScript / ESM files.

ğŸ“„ Articles & Tutorials

How to Do a JS to TypeScript Conversion â€” Chris, who led the conversion of a 150k LOC app to TypeScript, addresses a common question: do-it-as-you-go or follow the dependency graph?

Chris Krycho

Exploring the Headless Component Pattern for Composing React UIs â€” An engineer at Atlassian takes us on a thorough and practical journey into the concept of headless components and the pattern of having reusable logic and behavior separate from the presentation of UI elements.

Juntao Qiu

ğŸ“ Calling JavaScript Devs! Sentry Launch Week is Coming. Join Online

Sentry sponsor

â–¶  8 Talks from JetBrains' JavaScript Day 2023 â€” JavaScript Day is an annual virtual event featuring a handful of talks on diverse JS related topics. This year, Romulo Cintra shows us how TC39 works on language proposals, Stefan Baumgartner spoke about the lies we tell ourselves using TypeScript, and more.

JetBrains

Writing Components That Work in Any Framework â€” Looks at why web components can be difficult to adopt, and shows how using a higher-level library can let us â€œeasily write components that work everywhereâ€.

Andrico Karoulla

Build a Lightweight Code Generator with TypeScript and JSON Imports
John Ruble

Deploying a Vue Application with Netlify and GitHub
Ezekiel Lawson (Telerik)

Don't Disable Buttons, Do This..
Chris Ferdinandi

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

Moveable: A Library for Dragging, Resizing, Scaling and More â€” If you want to offer up physical manipulation of elements (warping, pinching, rotating, etc.) this library could help. Its homepage is a fun self-demo and there are packages for integrations with common frameworks.

Younkue Choi

ğŸ”¥ Need to Eliminate Tech Debt Without Falling into Dependency Hell? â€” Upgrade seamlessly and let us tackle tech debt with our fixed-cost, monthly maintenance service (starting at $2k/month).

UpgradeJS | Tech Debt Services sponsor

ğŸ–¼  image-dimensions: Get the Dimensions of Images â€” Sindreâ€™s latest creation is a simple but comprehensive one. A way to get the size (as width and height in pixels) for JPEG, PNG, APNG, and GIFs in any modern JS environment.

Sindre Sorhus

main-thread-scheduling 9.0: Consistently Responsive Apps While Staying on the Main Thread â€” An easier alternative to Web Workers that uses the approach of stopping heavy tasks on the main thread from executing when the user interacts with the UI. This new version adds afterFrame (like requestAnimationFrame but called after frame drawing has rendered), queueTask, and extensions to promises.

Antonio Stoilkov

React Components for the Google Maps JavaScript API â€” react-google-maps is the â€˜first Google-sponsored libraryâ€™ for integrating Google Maps JavaScript API components into a React app.

Mike Pegg (Google Cloud)

capture-website 4.0: Capture Screenshots of Websites â€” A Puppeteer wrapper to capture screenshots of site from Node or the command-line.

Sindre Sorhus

Never Stop Learning and Work #LikeABosch â€” At Bosch, you always keep growing. Upskill yourself into countless new roles, positions and opportunities. Learn more.

Bosch sponsor

âŒ˜K-sv: A Fast, Composable, Unstyled Command Menu for Svelte â€” A port of âŒ˜K, a React-based command menu component.

huntabyte

  • Vuetify v3.4 â€“ Vue component framework.

  • MiniSearch 6.2 â€“ In-memory fulltext search engine. (Demo.)

  • TanStack Form 0.9 â€“ Headless type-safe form state management.

  • Dependency Cruiser v15.2 â€“ Tool to validate and visualize dependencies.

  • Valtio v1.12.0 â€“ Proxy state made simple. Plus it has a fantastic homepage.

  • Helmet 7.1 â€“ Secure Express apps with HTTP headers.

  • Rollup.js 4.3 â€“ ES module bundler.

NOTABLE QUOTABLE

â€œThe first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.â€

___
Tom Cargill

ğŸš€ Everyone's gone to the moon..

Spacekit.js: A Library for Creating 3D Space Visualizations â€” Not just any old 3D space, but actual space â€“ think planets, stars, and meteors. A library like this comes, of course, with many examples to try. GitHub repo.

Ian Webster

#â€‹661 â€” November 2, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Next.js 14 Released â€” Unveiled at last weekâ€™s Next.js Conf, v14 caused a lot of community discussion (not least on Hacker News), largely surrounding Server Actions being declared stable and the 'backend-meets-frontend' opportunities this opens up. A new partial prerendering feature is also in preview, allowing for dynamic responses but with the speed of an initial static response.

Lee Robinson and Tim Neutkens

ğŸ’¡ The New Stack has an overview of the release, and Focus Reactive has a (highly visual) recap of Next.js Conf itself â€“ recommended if you didn't watch the stream.

SDKs & OpenAPI Specs in Minutes Using Zod, tsoa, or Fastify â€” Using popular TS tooling to build your API? Our guides show you how to go from code to best in class OpenAPI specs & SDKs.

Speakeasy sponsor

Remix â¤ï¸ Vite: Remix 2.2 Introduces Vite Support â€” Remix is a popular full-stack JavaScript framework that began as a paid product, but has been open source for two years now. If you found Remixâ€™s compilation approach opaque before, we have great news: â€œWith Vite, Remix is no longer a compiler. Remix itself is just a Vite plugin.â€ This post tells the full story.

Cattori and Dalgleish (Remix)

  • ğŸ—³ The folks behind the State of JavaScript survey have unveiled a new State of React survey to take. As with their other surveys, you get to test your knowledge as well as provide useful insights.

  • ğŸ” Shadow is a new, experimental browser engine built in JavaScript itself. It renders its output in your usual browser using an HTML canvas. Source code.

  • ğŸ” GitHub is scanning all public npm packages for leaked secrets. Note that if secrets are found, the provider associated with those secrets is notified.

  • â„ï¸ WinterJS is a new JS Service Workers server, powered by Rust & SpiderMonkey.

  • ğŸ¥ Uh-oh, it's Flappy Bird implemented in TypeScript types.

RELEASES:

  • Astro 3.4 â€“ The Web framework gains page partials, a new experimental dev overlay, and more.

  • Visual Studio Code October 2023 â€“ A couple of minor enhancements to the JS debugger, and Copilot Chat (if you have GitHub Copilot) can now provide better answers because it's sent implementation details behind the symbols you mention.

  • jQuery 4.0 is 100% feature complete but it's not released just yet.. but we know you can't wait. Ditto for Angular 17 â€“ more on that soon.

  • Rollup 4.2, Cypress 13.4, Ember.js 5.4, Stencil 4.7

ğŸ“’ Articles & Tutorials

Speeding Up the JavaScript Ecosystem: Tailwind CSS â€” Marvinâ€™s ongoing journey to improve our ecosystem by finding low-hanging performance-bearing fruit continues with a look at how the architecture of Tailwind CSS could be tuned.

Marvin Hagemeist

A New Way to Bring Garbage Collected Languages Efficiently to WebAssembly â€” WasmGC is a new and promising way to implement GC languages in WebAssembly and itâ€™s now enabled by default in Chrome.

Alon Zakai (V8)

Generally Awesome UI Components For Project Management and Scheduling â€” Level up your UX with advanced data grids, calendars, schedulers, and Gantt charts.

Bryntum sponsor

â–¶  Your Website Does Not Need JavaScript â€” An hour long talk in which Amy builds a completely static website â€” using a collection of HTML and CSS files with no tracking, no scripting, no servers, and no third-party resources.

Amy Kapernick

Building a Generic RSS Parser Service with Cloudflare Workers â€” Ray walks through various iterations and improvements in trying to build an RSS parser that can work in the Workers environment.

Raymond Camden

Can Next.js Handle 5000 Pages? â€” Christian set out to push both Next.js and AWS Amplify hard. A good read.

Christian Nwamba

ğŸ—£ Is Express Still the 'De-Facto' Choice for Building Node.js Webapps?
Hacker News

ğŸ›  Code & Tools

Svelte Flow: Node-Based UI for Svelte â€” From the creators of React Flow comes a Svelte version in the shape of a customizable Svelte component for building node-based editors and interactive diagrams. Check out the examples.

webkid GmbH

Docusaurus 3.0: Meta's Static Site Generator â€” Docusaurus is a popular React-powered tool aimed at building documentation sites, though it handles more general sites too. v3 features an upgrade to MDX v3, React 18, Mermaid v10, and essentially updates everything.

SÃ©bastien Lorber

Get Logged Values Right Where You Need Them: In Your Editor â€” Simply start your editor, and your development server/test runner in watch mode, and see values next to your code. No setup required.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Hotkey 2.2: Declarative Keyboard Shortcuts for HTML â€” Set a data-hotkey attribute on your elements to quickly add keyboard shortcuts. v2.2 improves Mac alt/option support.

GitHub

Is Text or Binary? 7.0 â€” This library first tries to determine from a filename if the contents of the associated file are likely to be binary or text. Failing that, it can then look at the actual data to figure it out.

Bevry

<browser-window>: A Web Component to Create Pretend Browser Windows on the Web â€” A lightweight themed zero-dependency web component wrapper to emulate a Safari-like browser window within a Web page. The page full of demos might give you some ideas for its use.

Zach Leatherman

Add Authorization, MFA, Biometrics to Your JavaScript App in Minutes

FusionAuth sponsor

lossless-json: Parse JSON Without Losing Numeric Information â€” JSON.parse can trip over when it comes to large numbers, so this library parses numeric values not as regular numbers but in a lightweight lossless way keeping the value as a string.

Jos de Jong

Vueform: An Open Source Form Framework for Vue.js â€” This has been around for a while but is now MIT licensed. Its ancillary form builder app stays commercial, but isn't mandatory for using the library. GitHub repo.

Vueform

  • sweetalert2 v11.9 â€“ Customizable, accessible replacement for alert()

  • YouTube.js 7.0 â€“ Wrapper around YouTube's internal API.

  • eslint-plugin-unicorn 49 â€“ Over 100 useful ESLint rules.

NOTABLE QUOTABLE

â€œIf it doesn't work, it doesn't matter how fast it doesn't work.â€

___
Mich Ravera

ğŸ’› And something else we love

Val Town 3.0: A Social Way to Write and Deploy TypeScript â€” â€œIf GitHub Gists Could Run, and AWS Lambda Were Funâ€ is a fantastic description for this online platform where you write tiny bite size functions (â€˜valâ€™s) to be run in V8 isolates. You can connect them together, schedule them, serve them up over HTTP, and more. Version 3 is a big jump for the platform, adding JSX support, more standardized JavaScript approaches to solving problems, and the ability to edit and run your â€˜valsâ€™ locally.

Steve Krouse
